storyInfo: The Doctor takes Amiya back to Babel and decides to help her and the other Infected as part of Babel. Theresa shows the Doctor the 'hope' that she has created through Originium.

attributes.content: Autumn, 1091
Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
How's progress, Closure?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The last thing I need is another core system control failure.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Well... Heh, since you had to bring it up, I might have run into a little problem.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Even with the tricks you taught me, the encryption methods used by many of PRTS's programs are almost incomprehensible to a normal brain, and my decoder isn't fully compatible yet.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We may not be able to shut the system down before the Doctor arrives on the ship.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Try again.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If you're not confident about getting it done, then we'll go to the contingency plan... cutting off power to the entire ship.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Leave it to me!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Seems like you're still keeping a lot of secrets, though.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I've never seen anyone make you so nervous.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: ...That's not important.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What's important is making sure nothing happens to the ship.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ascalon's report says the Doctor looks like an ordinary person. A pretty decent one, too, who picked up a stray little Cautus and carried her all across the land.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Do we really have to be so on edge?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: It's not the Doctor that I fear.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then what is it?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You don't need to know yet.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Wipe the Doctor's boarding records. This is for the safety of both the Doctor and Babel.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The others don't need to know that the Doctor exists until the Doctor and Theresa have reached a conclusion.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Alright, alright, I'll work at it.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: But I wonder why you seem to care a lot about this Doctor at that same time that you're so on guard over the whole thing.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I've got it! The Doctor must have dirt on you!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Don't bother, you won't find it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Come on, why so serious?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What about the girl?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Same conclusion, no change.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I cross-checked all relevant Rim Billitonian records and had Scout check with informants inside the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Amiya's background comes through clean.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Her parents were killed when the convoy transporting the laser mining module got attacked. The attack itself was purely coincidental.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: No one knew they were transporting Sarkaz-related cargo, and the Military Commission wasn't involved.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: She must have gotten Infected in the mess. If not for the Doctor, she'd be spending the rest of her life suffering in Rim Billiton.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I'll handle the girl's examination and treatment once she's on board.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You're still concerned about her?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Yes, I am.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She's too young, and she hasn't had proper treatment since contracting Oripathy.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Oh, that kind of concerned.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I don't want the Doctor's kindness to be the reason for delaying her treatment.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Plus, Theresa would call her a gentle child who has the right to choose her future.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Amiya. Amiya.
Mm... let me sleep... where are we?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Doctor... Doctor?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Doctor's here.
Wake up, sleepyhead. You're almost home.
Home?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: In her half-awake state, Amiya feels a warm fingertip brush her cheek.
Haha, that tickles, don't do that, hehe.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Whoa!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Wh-Who are you?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'm Theresa.
Theresa... the Doctor talked about you...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Oh? What did the Doctor say?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I don't remember... I was having a great carrot cake at the time, though.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Theresa should smell nice... be really warm and sweet...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: What about now? Is she as you imagined her?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yeah... smells good... warm and sweet... doesn't smell like carrots, though...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Not fully awake, I see. Heh.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Will you come home with us, Amiya?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Home... yeah... okay...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Outside Rhodes Island of Babel, Kazdel
The tiny Cautus sleeps soundly in Theresa's arms, leading against her neck.
She pats Amiya on the back and turns toward the Doctor, who is clearly tired.
Thank you, Theresa. I didn't expect you to come pick us up personally.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Looks like you're not quite all-knowing, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You have much to learn when it comes to childcare, at least.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Sure enough.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You look different from when you left, Doctor. How was the journey?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I saw a lot and learned a lot. There are plenty of interesting things on this great land.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I also met Amiya... it was a miracle that I was able to save her.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Amiya. She's even cuter than your letters said. Poor girl, but fortunate, in some way.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Her condition is getting worse. I needed to bring her in for treatment.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: How has Babel been, in the time that I was away?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Not quite smooth sailing. We have a lot to deal with, but not everything needs to be handled right away.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You must be tired after your journey. Get some rest.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you, Theresa.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Amiya, we're home.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Hmm... Doctor? Did I fall asleep?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Oh, Amiya. You're awake.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Why don't you come down? Theresa will get tired if she has to keep holding you.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Amiya nods and jumps down from Theresa's arms.
Will you hold my hand, Amiya?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Doctor...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: It's alright. Theresa is my friend. You can trust her. You'll be spending a lot of time with her from now on.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Is this Babel?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It's so big... even bigger than those mining plates. So this is where you used to live.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I spent a long time here... a very long time.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Is this your home?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Yes, Amiya, this is the Doctor's home. Right, Doctor?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It's your home now, too. Will you let us help the Doctor take care of you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Alright... I'll go wherever the Doctor goes.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: They step onto the elevator, and the Babel logo appears before their eyes.
The heavy door opens to welcome them in.
Sensing Amiya's unease, Theresa puts a hand on her shoulder.
What's behind the door?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: People waiting to welcome you and the Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Are you sure about taking me and the girl in, Theresa?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Why shouldn't I be? I'm glad to have more people calling Babel their home.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Many here don't know you, though, so I'm sure you'll be busy for the next few days.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: How should I present myself?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Good question. You should talk to Kal'tsit first. She's been waiting for you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Tell her your concerns, your questions, and the secrets in your heart.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: She would be very sad if you didn't.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You could have...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: If you really want the King of Sarkaz to reveal the thoughts that you're loath to tell, I will. But I can feel you're still wavering.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Let's go, Amiya, Doctor. We'll go to her.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Amiya. You're Amiya, aren't you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Kal'tsit crouches down and gives the girl a candy.
Thank you for protecting the Doctor throughout your journey, Amiya.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Thank you... Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Will you fetch Theresa? We need to do some checks on you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Will they hurt?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: A little. But the Doctor's letters called you a brave girl.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Will the Doctor be with me?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Of course. The Doctor has some things to do first, though.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's alright, Amiya. Just wait for me here in the ward, and I'll be back very soon.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...Okay.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You'll need to do a full checkup later too, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Do you plan on leaving again?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No, I think I've traveled enough.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: If you've made up your mind, I'll respect your decision.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If nothing else, you're concerned about Amiya's health... even though she was a complete stranger to you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is no fundamental difference between these new lives and us.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...I'm glad.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Glad that you chose hope, in the end.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Welcome back, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How is Amiya?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Blood Originium levels are high. Currently available inhibitors are not sufficient to stabilize her condition.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: We need to develop new drugs... I need time and resources.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Babel's are yours to use, Doctor. We're happy to share our research on Oripathy with you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What can I help you and Kal'tsit with in exchange?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: This is not a transaction. It's one of the core missions of Babel, to do everything in our power to help everyone suffering from Oripathy.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Since the day that Kal'tsit woke you up, I was convinced that you would help with all of this, just as you helped Amiya.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Now, perhaps, I have a chance to ask you this question, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: How do you view this land, Terra?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I don't think it's my place to judge.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: There's no such thing as superior or inferior civilizations. It took a long and hard journey for Terra to evolve to where it is today.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Add to that the sick joke that Originium has played on life...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You said that Originium did not develop the way you expected.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It wasn't supposed to bring such suffering.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Mumbles in her dream)
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I sense that you are keeping secrets, but there's nothing false about the sorrow coming from deep within your heart, the sorrow that I can't understand.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I want to fix this mistake, but I'm powerless to do so...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: At the end of the day, civilizations largely progress in similar ways. It all comes to an inevitable endpoint, however bright its light shines at its peak.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But Kal'tsit said you didn't give up hope, even in your final days.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I had many friends, even in those last days, who faced difficulties far greater than you can imagine, with courage and hope that is every bit your equal.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But they failed and faded away, without exception.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: We haven't known each other that long, Theresa. I want to know: Why do you do all this?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: What is the end that Babel seeks in compromising with the Military Commission?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: There's something I want to show you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We had to ask you about Originium, sooner or later. That's why Kal'tsit woke you up.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Please, come and see the results of my... brief time at work.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: We're almost there...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This place is barren, even by the standards of a Catastrophe-heavy region. But Closure has spent time and effort to maintain this dangerous little trail...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: A forked trail in the midst of Originium formations. You're not keeping any fewer secrets than I am, Theresa.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: A King of Sarkaz has to have a few secrets, right?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Don't tell anyone what you see here.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A long trek through the Originium-filled wasteland leads to a small garden.
In the heart of a Catastrophe, amidst the ruins, on a nameless plain that neither night nor the stars can find.
Tiny white specks mark this little sanctuary, isolated from the rest of the world, and the wild lands around it. Even the winds seem softer here.
It is a forgotten greenhouse that harkens back to a time in the distant past, when the land was still pure and untainted.
Like when man stole fire from up above and lit up a corner of the night sky.
Theresa picks up a white flower.
This place represents the cutting edge of Babel's and my research into Originium.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Flowers...?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No. Originium.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm sure you understand it's not Originium Arts that made these flowers bloom.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The information inherent in Originium, the reversal of the Assimilated Universe...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You've already come this far? When did...?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No race understands Originium better than the Sarkaz. Still, what we know is merely the tip of the iceberg compared to the entirety of Originium.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even with Kal'tsit helping us understand the nature of Originium, the furthest we have gone is transforming a palm-sized piece of active Originium into this...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Garden.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Hope.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This little flower is my small contribution. I need your help, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I want to see the day when flowers cover the cliffs and valleys of Kazdel, and all the lands beyond.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It's a future worth taking risks for.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You've seen how Kazdel has been mired in war for its entire history, Doctor.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Right now, at least, I want to use the power of Originium to create a home for Kazdel where people can live in peace, safe from war and invasion.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: In the more distant future... if we're able to fully harness it, we'll be able to change the entire face of Terra.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If Catastrophes don't bring rain of Originium, but soft fluffy clouds...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If the Infected no longer suffer the pain of rocks growing out of them...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I don't suppose there's anyone who would have such an absurd dream.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You're different from other Sarkaz, Theresa.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Flowers that cover the entire land...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: What a picture of life that would be.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Why... why this flower?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Oh... there's no particular reason. I just happened to come across it outside the valley when I was looking for a good place for my experiments.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: A pure coincidence.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kal'tsit said it had a name. 'Snow-in-summer'.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But it's adapted to changes over the years. Perhaps we could give it a new name.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What do you think, Doctor?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.text: A new path is opening up.

attributes.content: Can you hear me, Theresa?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm listening. I was giving the Doctor a tour of our...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Urgent news from Kazdel.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It concerns Victoria.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit
